(1998) {{Singles | Name = Words | Type = Studio | single 1 = [[Nobody Knows (Tony Rich song)|Nobody Knows]] | single 1 date = January 14, 1996 | single 2 = Like a Woman | single 2 date = August 5, 1996 | single 3 = Leavin' | single 3 date = November 11, 1996 }} }} '''''Words''''' is the debut album of American [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] musician [[Tony Rich]], released January 16, 1996 on [[LaFace Records]]. The album is produced, written, arranged and performed by Tony Rich. In 1997, the album won a Grammy Award for the Best R&B Album. At the start of 1996 with the acoustic R&B ballad, "Nobody Knows", the song was a hit peaking at #2 for 2 weeks, going platinum, and spending almost a year on the [[Billboard Hot 100]] (47 weeks).{{Fact|date=February 2009}} In total three singles were released from ''Words'': "Nobody Knows", "Like a Woman", and "Leavin'". ==Track listing== # "Hey Blue" â 3:48 # "[[Nobody Knows (Tony Rich song)|Nobody Knows]]" â 5:06 # "Like a Woman" â 4:08 # "Grass is Green" â 4:08 # "Ghost" â 4:21 # "Leavin'" â 3:44 # "Billy Goat" â 4:11 # "Under Her Spell" â 4:24 # "Little Ones" â 3:37 # "Missin' You" â 3:49 ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:1996 albums]] [[Category:Debut albums]] [[Category:Tony Rich albums]] [[Category:Grammy Award for Best R&B Album]]
